meanings.definition: To fall or let fall in drops.
meanings.sent1: I watched the raindrops drop from the sky.
meanings.sent2: Please drop the coin into the piggy bank.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet decided to drop a surprise visit in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to drop when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The tears drop silently down her cheeks.

meanings.definition: A small quantity of liquid that falls or is produced in a more or less spherical mass; a liquid globule.
meanings.sent1: The raindrop landed softly on the window.
meanings.sent2: She added a drop of vanilla extract to the batter.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler thought the water drop was a tiny bouncing ball.
meanings.sent4: The drop of honey on the spoon glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The drop of dew on the leaf sparkled like a tiny diamond.

meanings.definition: To let fall in drops or small portions.
meanings.sent1: She carefully dropped the paint onto the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The chef will drop the sauce onto the dish just before serving.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student decided to drop hints about the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: His voice seemed to drop with each word he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The sun began to drop below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: To fall in globules or small portions, as water or other liquid.
meanings.sent1: The raindrops drop gently on the roof.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream started to drop from the cone in the heat.
meanings.sent3: The water drop seemed to dance as it fell from the leaf.
meanings.sent4: The stars drop from the sky like shimmering diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The paint drop splattered on the floor, creating a colorful mess.

meanings.definition: To fall vertically; have an abrupt descent.
meanings.sent1: The elevator will drop to the ground floor.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster will drop suddenly after reaching the top.
meanings.sent3: The temperature seemed to drop rapidly as the storm approached.
meanings.sent4: Her stomach felt like it would drop as the plane descended.
meanings.sent5: The rock climber felt a rush of adrenaline as he prepared to drop down the cliff.
